title: RTL 4
text:
RTL 4 (Radio Télévision Luxembourg 4) is a Dutch <a href="free-to-air">free-to-air</a> television channel; it is the most-watched commercial station in the country, popular especially with those aged between 20 and 49. RTL 4 is a general entertainment channel with <a href="infotainment">infotainment</a>, <a href="television%20drama">television drama</a>, <a href="talk%20shows">talk shows</a>, <a href="game%20shows">game shows</a>, <a href="news">news</a> and <a href="talent%20shows">talent shows</a>. It is owned by <a href="RTL%20Nederland">RTL Nederland</a>, a subsidiary of <a href="RTL%20Group">RTL Group</a>. The station has three sister TV channels: <a href="RTL%205">RTL 5</a>, <a href="RTL%207">RTL 7</a> and <a href="RTL%208">RTL 8</a>, and four thematic TV channels: <a href="RTL%20Z">RTL Z</a>, <a href="RTL%20Lounge">RTL Lounge</a>, <a href="RTL%20Crime%20%28Dutch%20TV%20channel%29">RTL Crime</a> and <a href="RTL%20Telekids">RTL Telekids</a>.
Officially RTL 4 - along with <a href="RTL%205">RTL 5</a>, <a href="RTL%207">RTL 7</a> and <a href="RTL%208">RTL 8</a> - is headquartered in <a href="Hilversum">Hilversum</a>, broadcasting under a <a href="Luxembourg">Luxembourg</a> TV license. This allows them to avoid more strict control by the Dutch media authorities as Luxembourg's television watchdog is less strict. Despite being intended for Dutch audiences, RTL 4 is encrypted on the Dutch DVB-T Digitenne platform but free-to-air in Luxembourg.
History.
It originally launched on the <a href="Astra%201A">Astra 1A</a> satellite as "RTL Véronique" on 2 October 1989, before re-branding as RTL 4 the next year. 1, 2 and 3 were already used by the Netherlands' public broadcasters. It was one of the first private commercial broadcaster in the Netherlands. Officially, it still broadcasts from <a href="Luxembourg">Luxembourg</a>. Private broadcasters were not allowed in the Netherlands until 1992. The encryption system employed by both RTL 4 and 5 analogue services whilst on the Astra 1A and <a href="Astra%201C">1C</a> satellites was <a href="Luxcrypt">Luxcrypt</a>. This standard was employed in order to protect the distribution rights sold by foreign studios to RTL.
RTL 4 broadcasts the first and the longest running <a href="Soap%20opera">soap</a> of the Netherlands, "<a href="Goede%20Tijden%2C%20Slechte%20Tijden">Goede Tijden, Slechte Tijden</a>" (since 1 October 1990).
RTL 4's latest radical change of programming was on 18 August 2007 when RTL obtained the soccer rights (Eredivisie) but lost the rights to the <a href="Nederlandse%20Omroep%20Stichting">NOS</a> the following year. In 2008 RTL 4 went back to its roots as a family entertainment channel with programmes such as "<a href="Idols%20%28Dutch%20TV%20series%29">Idols</a>", "<a href="X%20Factor%20%28Netherlands%29">X Factor</a>", "<a href="Dancing%20with%20the%20Stars">Dancing with the Stars</a>" and "<a href="Dancing%20on%20Ice%20around%20the%20world">Dancing on Ice</a>". That year RTL 4 also launched "<a href="Ik%20Hou%20Van%20Holland">Ik Hou Van Holland</a>", a quiz-show around and about the Netherlands with <a href="Linda%20De%20Mol">Linda De Mol</a>.
From 2009 the talent shows are playing a major role in the programming of RTL 4, the "X-Factor" has been rescheduled successfully to Friday night with higher ratings in Season 2 (2009) and Season 3 (2010) on Fridays. In 2010, RTL 4 bought the rights for broadcasting "<a href="Holland%27s%20Got%20Talent">Holland's Got Talent</a>" from <a href="SBS%206">SBS 6</a> and created together with pioneer <a href="John%20De%20Mol">John De Mol</a> their own talent show "<a href="The%20Voice%20of%20Holland">The Voice of Holland</a>" in the Autumn of that same year. "The Voice of Holland" became a huge hit on Dutch Television with ratings around 3 million viewers every Friday Night. In 2012 yet another new talent show started, "<a href="Beat%20the%20Best">Beat the Best</a>".
RTL 4 also owns the rights for the soaps "<a href="As%20the%20World%20Turns">As the World Turns</a>" and "<a href="The%20Bold%20and%20the%20Beautiful">The Bold and the Beautiful</a>". In January 2007, RTL sold the rights for "B&B" to <a href="SBS6">SBS6</a>, but bought the rights back in December 2010. With more money and space to buy other TV shows, RTL 4 bought the rights for the first season of the successful drama show "<a href="Brothers%20%26amp%3B%20Sisters%20%282006%20TV%20series%29">Brothers & Sisters</a>" and took over "" from sister channel RTL 5.
Television host Peter van der Vorst has been appointed Content and Marketing Director of RTL Nederland. He will start on 1 March 2019.
Radio.
From May 1991 until September 2006, the station has had several accompanying radio stations, such as RTL 4 Radio, RTL Radio, RTL Rock Radio, Happy RTL, and RTL FM. Between June 2007 and 1 January 2012 RTL Nederland owned <a href="Radio%20538">Radio 538</a>, one of the largest radio stations of the Netherlands.
Programming.
Hits on RTL 4 include the <a href="RTL%20Nieuws">RTL Nieuws</a>, Editie NL, <a href="RTL%20Boulevard">RTL Boulevard</a>, <a href="Goede%20Tijden%2C%20Slechte%20Tijden">Goede Tijden, Slechte Tijden</a> and the Saturday night family show <a href="Ik%20hou%20van%20Holland">Ik hou van Holland</a>. Talent shows are also very popular on RTL 4, such as <a href="Idols%20%28Dutch%20TV%20series%29">Idols</a>, <a href="X%20Factor%20%28Netherlands%29">X Factor</a>, <a href="Holland%27s%20Got%20Talent">Holland's Got Talent</a>, <a href="Supernanny">Supernanny</a> and <a href="The%20Voice%20of%20Holland">The Voice of Holland</a>. RTL 4 also owns the rights for American TV series.
As is the practice with other television and film services nationwide, programmes in another language as well as portions of local programmes with foreign language dialogue are carried with Dutch subtitles in lieu of dubbing.
Teletext.
RTL 4 offered a teletext service which stopped on 1 April 2017. The pages 888/889 are still available for subtitles.
